Reviews.Title: “You might reserve, but you might not get to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review on behalf of my sister, who recently reserved a room - months ahead of time - to stay at the Pirate's Cove. She had all of the appropriate confirmation information regarding her trip. Her flight, however, was going to arrive in the evening on the date of her check-in. The front office here informed her that they close at 9pm. First of all, what kind of establishment located in Daytona Beach closes that early? The Motel 6 in Paris, Ohio is open for check-in all night, for crying out loud. Second of all, what kind of establishment closes that early in the height of tourist season? This reservation was set for mid-July, 2012. Magnanimously, the office agreed to keep someone there until 930pm, but if my sister arrived after that time, they would leave a key to her room. I am happy to report, they did, at least, do that much. However, when my sister went up to that room, there were two other women already settled in it. After much discussion and debate, the group was able to get ahold of the Pirate's Cove's owner, who, at that moment, informed my sister that 2 days prior she had taken that room's rental off the market. There was no contact, courteous or otherwise, which informed her of this. She found out WHEN SHE ARRIVED IN HER ROOM, and only after this little dispute forced a call to the owner. So, needless to say, you can make a reservation here. You may even get a confirmation of that reservation. However, they may decide to pull that rug out from under you at any time, even as little as 2 days before you're departing for your vacation, AND THEY MAY NOT EVEN TELL YOU ABOUT IT. This is NOT the way I would like to be treated if I'm planning a trip to Daytona, whether I were alone or with a family of six. Think about that before calling or clicking.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it! Come Every Year”
Reviews.Author: Tyler P
Reviews.Content: I consistently stay at Private's Cove every year for my vacation. Enjoy the staff, view and have tried many of the rooms. Feels like home. You take care of your room no one bothers you or wakes you up with housekeeping. Close to the Inlet for fishing. Didn't need to more my car at all. Everything is close by. It will be great when the Gym opens too.

Reviews.Title: “***EXCELLENT STAFF & IMPROVEMENTS***”
Reviews.Author: Elaine W
Reviews.Content: Me and my family of four stayed at Pirates Cove about a year ago and boy have they made some major improvments. The pool has been resurfaced, a lot of the rooms have been remodeled. The room has pretty much everything that we needed, could of used a blow drier. The staff was more than understanding and lept at our every need. We will definately be visiting PC again.

Reviews.Title: “great time in the sun”
Reviews.Author: pablo m
Reviews.Content: the view was perfect,front desk went out they're way to help. i would deffenetly go there next year . we didn't even have to use our cars ,walking distance. we stayed a week and wanted another week but work calls,next year we will try two weeks. the location its really busy ,but that's exactly what the doctor orde. hope this helps with anyone stay .

Reviews.Title: “Good Value -- With Qualifications”
Reviews.Author: RoadVet
Reviews.Content: You can really make this place work for you, if you're willing to do without some conveniences that you may have gotten used to! Consider these qualifications: There's no daily maid service. Do you really need this? There's no complimentary breakfast. With what you're saving, you can treat yourself to breakfast out every day ... OR ... you can make your own coffee and a quick breakfast using the small efficiency kitchen. The room is a bit older, in need of some sprucing up, including paint. Chances are, unless you've gone through a remodel at home in the last five years, this place may be in better repair than your own home. If I were to stay here again, I would bring drawer liners for the dresser and extra towels, including mat, for the bath. Bed is comfy, and AC is in tip-top shape. Pool is HUGE and awesome. Parking lot is well-lit and secure. Definitely a no-frills vacation for us. The price was VERY right, even if the space took a bit of getting used to. We're uncertain about coming back, but mainly because we like to patronize the smaller mom 'n pop motels lest they give way to pricey condos and trendy chains.

Reviews.Title: “German Roaches is that enough!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wildwoodmark27
Reviews.Content: We thought we got a steal on the low price and boy were we wrong. It's a little dirty and run down but the main problem was the German Roaches crawling everywhere and the air was frozen. The view is great and the maintenance guy is super awesome. He went out of his way trying to fix the air. Run though, it ruined our vacation and we had to overpay to get in a hotel so it wasn't a total waste of trip. The laundry mat is a joke as well.

Reviews.Title: “We made it work!”
Reviews.Author: Prudence L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pirates Cove the first week of April 2012. Our room (514) was a little rough around the edges, but we made it work. Everything in the room was older, so it seemed "dirty." We just picked up some cleaner and wiped everything down ourselves and felt fine about the room after that. The room had tile, so this was nice. We didn't have to worry about nasty carpet. Everything worked in the kitchen area, so we were able to cook meals rather than eating out. The pots and pans were minimal, but okay. There were cups, plates and silverware, but we went a bought disposable because there was no dishwasher and we didn't want to spend all week washing dishes. The beds we definately needed to be upgraded, but were clean and after being exhausted from the beach all day were fine. Shower had good pressure, so no complaints there. The pool area was nice enough. The pool is not heated, but we were at the beach most of the time, so it didn't bother us. We loved have a private balcony. We wish the pool would have been lit, so we could have enjoyed the pool area after dark when the beach wasn't available. The A/C in our room also needed updating, but kept the room comfortable, but not cold like we normally would like it. You could tell this place use to be happening, but just needs some TLC now. It was also quiet... we were there over Spring Break and there was no craziness to speak of. If you are expecting 5 stars for $500 for 7 nights, come on, you're an idiot. We would stay again, I think we would just try to have them find us a room that is a little more updated.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Vera145
Reviews.Content: We will be returning to this privately owned unit (#423). We stayed in this unit in 2011 when it was just bought and liked it enough to come back in 2012. The owners made some changes to the unit making it feel more like a home than a hotel. Looking forward to coming back again. Love experiencing both the sunrise and sunset views.

Reviews.Title: “BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: curiousinkg
Reviews.Content: I know it's a little late to write a review, but I just need to warn people that the price IS too good to be true. My family and I have stayed here many times over the past 10 years, but the cleaning crew and maintenance have gone down hill ever since. They claim to have had a million $ renovation a few years ago, but it's in bad shape all over the patio/pool area, and we had a terrible roach problem the entire week we were there. They sprayed 2 times, but it didn't help, and we were not offered a new room until the last day of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Spot on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: joquittschre
Reviews.Content: Most beautiful ocean front view on the rear deck . Loved the convenience of getting from I-95 to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice efficiency unit saved on meals, Extremely helpful front desk.”
Reviews.Author: Patriot_1137
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the private balcony. Having breakfast and coffee while watching dolphins swim along the coast line. I will be back first chance I can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Vacation-Direct Ocean front w/ Privat balcony and full kithcens”
Reviews.Author: RM1137
Reviews.Content: Our family an I will definately be back. The front desk personal went out of their way for us. We had a great summer vacation and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: marktheman777
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for the 4th of July weekend. We had a great stay..Our room was oceanfront with a private balcony overlooking the water and a a full kitchen. We looked at other places in the area and for what we got, it was at least $60 less than any other hotel around and well worth it

Reviews.Title: “Motel Hell”
Reviews.Author: Fitz152
Reviews.Content: Pirat's cove was filthy, and old. No bar, no restaurant, no one at the front desk when we arrived. Our room key and parking pass was left in our unlocked room. The room was dirty, with out dated furniture, and bugs. We were suppose to stay four nights and left after one. We wouldn't of stayed the one night but we arrived from our flight late. we went right up the road to Holiday Inn Express, which was great by the way!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hidden Secret”
Reviews.Author: karenconroy61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the weekend at Pirates Cove in Daytona Beach. This place is a "hidden secret"!!! Our room was spotless; the view was exceptional and the PRICE WAS RIGHT!!!! The location is perfect because you're right off of Dunlawton. If you're needing a "BEACH FIX" this is a great place to stay in Daytona Beach!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 4MoreSunshine
Reviews.Content: This is not a brand-new property, but the units are beautifully decorated and well maintained. Ours was very clean and everything worked perfectly - including, thankfully- the air conditioner and TV. It was the perfect size for us and the location could not have been better. The beach view from the balcony was the World's Best and the fun/excitement of Daytona beach "tourist zone" was close enough to enjoy and just far enough to leave behind when we were ready. We would go again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: jen5883
Reviews.Content: Pirate's Cove is by far the dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed in. The walls were dirty and cracked, there were no covers over the outlets, the furniture was very old and busted up, the towels and sheets and blankets didn't feel or look very clean, the bathroom was tiny and very dirty, the air conditioner froze up, so it was hot all night long while we were trying to sleep, the toilet barely flushed, and the drain in the shower was clogged. The only nice things about our room were the flat screen t.v., which seemed very out of place in this dated room, and the view of the beach and ocean. I would not stay there again until I have seen that this place has cleaned it's act up.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunloverMemphis
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 5 day stay so much we are going back this year. The room was clean an neat.The view was just beautiful. The pool was clean.No restaurant , but so what we enjoyed walking to the ones close by.

Reviews.Title: “bad, no pool or restaurant”
Reviews.Author: better21
Reviews.Content: Weather was great. Loved daytona but would never stay at this place again The pool was closed as was the restaurant and bar. Construction going on in lobby and roof. Place was almost empty and now we know why. Sheets clean but blanket dirty. Front desk closed at 7 and no assistance after that, Very poorly run business

HotelInfo.Name: Pirate's Cove
HotelInfo.Address: 3501 S Atlantic Ave, Daytona Beach, FL 32118
